original: Lindblad, Anders Fredrik, professor, Göteborg, f. 3/6/88 i Bjuv, Mal-möh. 1., av bergsing. Robert L. o. Agnes Bergström. G. m. Märta Hedén. — Utex. fr. CTI 13, Dr. of Sc. v. Univ. of Michigan, USA, 23. Anst. v. Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B 13-14, Hälsin^b. Varv 14-15, The Amer. Ship Building Co., Cleveland, USA, 15-18, Assist. Prof. of Naval Architecture v. Univ. of Michigan 18-28, Assoc. Prof. där 28-33, prof. i skeppsbygg, v. CTI 33, i teor. skeppsbygg, v. CTH sed. 41. Utf. undersökn. f. amer. re-ger:komm. betr. fribord f. fartyg å Stora Sjöarna 20-21. Konsult, verk-samh. samt sakk :uppdr. f. sjöf :mål. Stud:res. t. Danm., Tyskl. 26-27, m. stip. ur A. H. Lindfors fond t. Engl. 27 o. 37. Skr.: avh. o. upps. i sv. o. amer. facktidskr. RNO.
translated: Lindblad, Anders Fredrik, professor, Gothenburg, b. 3/6/88 in Bjuv, Malmöhus County. Son of mining engineer Robert L. and Agnes Bergström. Married to Märta Hedén. — Graduated from CTI in 1913, Doctor of Science from the University of Michigan, USA, in 1923. Employed at Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B from 1913-1914, Hälsingborg Shipyard from 1914-1915, The American Ship Building Co. in Cleveland, USA, from 1915-1918. Assistant Professor of Naval Architecture at the University of Michigan from 1918-1928, Associate Professor from 1928-1933, Professor of Shipbuilding at CTI from 1933, of Theoretical Shipbuilding at CTH since 1941. Conducted research for the American government regarding freeboard for vessels on the Great Lakes from 1920-1921. Consulted and served as an expert for maritime matters. Studied in Denmark and Germany from 1926-1927, with scholarships from the A. H. Lindfors Fund to England in 1927 and 1937. Written several dissertations and articles in Swedish and American scientific journals. Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO).

affiliation.name: The American Ship Building Co., Cleveland, USA

governmentResearch.name: Research on freeboard for vessels on the Great Lakes

articles.name: Dissertations and articles in Swedish and American scientific journals

awards.name: Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO)
